head.title: Arts, Briefly; No Parthenon in Ads

hedline.hl1: Arts, Briefly; No Parthenon in Ads

body.head.byline: By ANTHEE CARASSAVA; Compiled by Peter Edidin

block.p: The Greek government said yesterday that Verizon Communications had agreed to scrap an advertisement featuring a photograph of the Parthenon. The Greek culture minister, George Voulgarakis, had accused Verizon of ''commercial exploitation'' of that 2,500-year-old temple in a print advertisement published in the American edition of The Financial Times. Greece bans commercial use of images of its ancient monuments unless authorized by the country's supreme archaeological council.
